channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Wetter and cooler weather in June and July is not unusual, say experts
item.description:
July 19, 2020 11:59 AM

This June was the wettest in the last decade and the coolest in the last 20 years.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on July 19
Hopes high for Singapore-Malaysia cross-border travel
item.description:
July 19, 2020 5:00 AM

For people stuck on either side of the Causeway, the possible resumption of cross-border travel between Singapore and Malaysia is cause for optimism.

item.title: ST turns 175: Capturing election campaigns over the years
item.description:
July 19, 2020 5:00 AM

The Straits Times has been documenting key developments in Singapore's political history over the years, from the first election to Singapore's Legislative Assembly in 1955, to the 13th parliamentary general election on July 10 this year.

item.title: Coronavirus: Man's daily video calls with family in Johor Baru end in teary goodbyes
item.description:
July 19, 2020 5:00 AM

It has been four months since Mr Terry Mariyadas, 35, was separated from his family, and his wife is worried sick.

item.title: Coronavirus: Mum quit job to reunite with child in Johor but dad is in Singapore
item.description:
July 19, 2020 5:00 AM

Ms Shermaine Chan was torn between staying in Singapore with her husband and returning to Malaysia to see her one-year-old daughter. After four months apart since Malaysia shut its border on March 18, Ms Chan quit her retail job to return to Johor last Monday.

item.title: 202 new cases reported here, including 7 in the community
item.description:
July 19, 2020 5:00 AM

Parklane shopping mall, Albert Centre, JCube and the food park at Lorong Lew Lian are among places visited by Covid-19 patients in the community while they were still infectious, said the Ministry of Health (MOH) yesterday.

item.title: Birthday joy for grandma, the longest-staying Covid-19 patient at NUH
item.description:
July 19, 2020 5:00 AM

Choy Wai Chee, 58, has been in a life-and-death fight against Covid-19 for the past four months.

item.title: DSO, A*Star develop new test kit that cuts processing time
item.description:
July 19, 2020 5:00 AM

Scientists here have developed an improved Covid-19 test kit that can deliver results more quickly - halving processing time from about four hours to less than two.

item.title: Demand for local produce must match supply: Amy Khor
item.description:
July 19, 2020 5:00 AM

Although an overwhelming majority of people here said they would buy more locally grown food, only around two-thirds of them can easily identify home-grown produce.

item.title: Coronavirus: When will it be safe to work out at gyms or go on vacation?
item.description:
July 19, 2020 5:00 AM

Opinions differ widely on when it is safe to restart these activities.Â

item.title: $100k of new mental health fund for peer initiatives
item.description:
July 19, 2020 5:00 AM

A new $1 million fund aimed at addressing mental health issues among young people here will set aside a total of $100,000 for peer-run initiatives.

item.title: Veteran diplomat Tony Kemal Siddique, 80, dies of heart attack
item.description:
July 19, 2020 5:00 AM

Veteran diplomat Tony Kemal Siddique died on Friday night of a heart attack.

item.title: Muslim couples learn about foster parenting in webinar
item.description:
July 19, 2020 5:00 AM

More than 50 couples attended a three-hour virtual seminar on foster parenting in Islam yesterday, hearing from religious experts, veteran foster parents and social workers.
